intro: Brickellia colimae, commonly known as the Mexican brickellbush, is a flowering plant native to central Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Brickellia colimae is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
